name: cookstove production, gas or electric | cookstove | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/19946/documentation

This activity represents the production and disposal of an average gas or electric cookstove.The appliance is 57.9 kg in mass and has power of 2.5 kW. It has the envisaged lifetime of 15 years and is manufactured in Europe.The figures on material inputs from technosphere and energy required to produce an average cookstove are taken from Jungbluth 1997. The figure on the annual production volume is extrapolated from the US combined production volume of gas and electric stoves.

This activity starts with the reception of materials at the factory.

The activity includes the processes of material and energy use in manufacturing of an average, gas or electric cookstove. The inventory additionally accounts for disposal of all materials. Packaging is not included.
category: C:Manufacturing/27:Manufacture of electrical equipment/275:Manufacture of domestic appliances/2750:Manufacture of domestic appliances

processDocumentation.timeDescription: The literature sources used refer to the underpinning technology as being current.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Geography GLO was chosen because the dataset aims to represent the production of an average, gas or electric cookstove. The literature sources used refer to manufacturing in Europe.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: The literature sources used refer to manufacturing in Europe.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Data on annual world production volume is extrapolated from the volume of US production.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Manufacturing data are taken from Jungbluth 1997. Source:  Jungbluth, N., 1997. Life-cycle-assessment for stoves and ovens. UNS working paper No.16. Available from: http://esu-services.ch/fileadmin/download/jungbluth-1997-WP16-LCA-cooking.pdf (Accessed 20 January 2018). The figure on the annual world production volume is extrapolated from the US combined production volume of gas and electric stoves. Source: Statista 2017. Electric/gas cooking appliances and microwaves unit shipments in the United States from 2013 to 2016 (in millions). Available from: https://www.statista.com/statistics/271530/shipments-of-cooking-appliances-in-the-us-since-2009/ (Accessed 14 January 2018). For extrapolation, the nominal GDP of 2014 was used. Source: Eurostat 2016. The EU in the world - economy and finance. Available from: http://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/statistics-explained/index.php/The_EU_in_the_world_-_economy_and_finance (Accessed 14 January 2018). Gross domestic product (GDP) at current prices is GDP at prices of the current reporting period, also known as nominal GDP. The US combined production volume of gas and electric stoves in 2016 is 8.38 million units. The US contribution to global GDP in 2014 is 22.2%. Consequently, the global production volume of gas and electric cookstoves can be estimated as 8.38 million x 100 / 22.2 = 37.75 million units.

flow.name: cookstove

exchanges.description: Estimated value.The input of infrastructure is approximated with the exchange 'metal working factory', this was chosen as metal is the main material constituting the final product. The general comment for the activity 'metal working faculty, GLO' [accessed 19.01.2018] specifies: '4.58E-10 units of this process are needed to produce 1 kg of final product. Additionally, the dataset for 'metal working factory' needs to be used together with the 'energy and auxilliary inputs, metal working factory', 1 kg of this exchange is required per 1 kg of final product.
